newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end firm amid operation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end firm amid operation.

text.p: Pakistan's inter-bank money market rates ended firm on Thursday despite an open market operation of about 4.0 billion rupees by the State (centra) Bank of Pakistan (SBP), dealers said.
They said the market was short as evident from SBP discounting.
"Term rate did escalate nominally today, but no major trades were conducted," a dealer at KASB & Co said.
Three-month bids and offers were quoted at 16 and 16.75 percent respectively and two-month bids and offers at 16.25 and 16.50 percent. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
